Instruction: Preheat grill to medium-high heat (around 400 degrees Fahrenheit).
Wash salmon fillet and pat dry with paper towels.
In a small bowl, combine olive oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, dill, salt, and pepper.
Rub the marinade evenly over the salmon fillet.
Place salmon fillet on the preheated grill, skin-side down.
Cook for about 5-7 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 145 degrees Fahrenheit.
Remove from grill and let rest for a few minutes before serving.
Garnish with additional lemon slices and fresh dill if desired.
